e4: Switching to the new policy promotes ethical financial reporting by ensuring accuracy and transparency, essential for maintaining investor trust in the long run. Although there might be initial confusion due to the shift from the prior biased reporting, effective communication can mitigate misunderstanding. This ethical approach not only aligns with regulatory standards but likely reduces legal risks and enhances corporate reputation.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and accountability. It must provide all stakeholders, including lesser-informed investors, with clear and honest information, allowing no room for deliberate misinterpretations or modifications. Ethical considerations might also include the inclusive communication of any changes in reporting practices to ensure that all investors understand the implications equally, reducing the risk of disadvantaging any party due to informational asymmetries.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to effectively communicate the policy change to all investors to ensure understanding and trust in the new, unbiased reporting. Additionally, I would inquire about any measures or strategies in place to monitor the immediate market response and any investor confusion that may arise due to the transition from the old to the new policy.
